head.title: A Senator Blocks Money for Peace

hedline.hl1: A Senator Blocks Money for Peace

abstract.p: Letter from Holly Burkhalter says Sen Judd Gregg, who is blocking United States from paying $96 million it owes to United Nations for peacekeeping mission in Sierra Leone, is giving gift to rebel force there (May 20 article)

block.p: United Nations peacekeepers are responsible for disarming the rebels in Sierra Leone and protecting the civilian population. By blocking the United States from paying the $96 million it owes to the United Nations for the peacekeeping mission in Sierra Leone, Senator Judd Gregg, chairman of the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee, gives a gift to the rebel force (front page, May 20).

United Nations peacekeepers are responsible for disarming the rebels in Sierra Leone and protecting the civilian population. By blocking the United States from paying the $96 million it owes to the United Nations for the peacekeeping mission in Sierra Leone, Senator Judd Gregg, chairman of the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee, gives a gift to the rebel force (front page, May 20).

Senator Gregg is right to be critical of the American-brokered peace agreement last year that offered the rebels total amnesty for their crimes and included them in a coalition government. But it is worth noting that no country other than Nigeria was willing to send its soldiers to Sierra Leone to do battle with the rebels, and the Senate offered no alternative proposal when Nigeria withdrew its forces from Sierra Leone last year.
Today, with United Nations forces and Nigerians in position, the rebels might actually be disarmed and demobilized for good.
The writer is the advocacy director for Physicians for Human Rights.
